required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Manual Lymphatic Drainage Before and After Total Knee Replacement, a Single-center Observer-blinded Randomized Controlled Trial
clinical_study.official_title: Manual Lymphatic Drainage Before and After Total Knee Replacement, a Single-center Observer-blinded Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this observer-blinded randomized controlled trial is the evaluation of the influence of manual lymphatic drainage (MLD) on the outcome of patients receiving total knee replacement (TKA).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Randomized controlled trial with three treatment groups, two intervention groups and one control group
study_design_info.masking_description: Observer/Investigators are unaware of the treatment arm of each patient. Patients cannot be blinded, due to the obvious treatment intervention (manual lymphatic drainage 15 minutes for 5 days).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in swelling weeks before the operation to one year after the operation
primary_outcome.description: The swelling/volume is calculated through measurements of the circumference at 7 distinct points of the leg. The unit is [mm].

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in ROM weeks before the operation to one year after the operation
primary_outcome.description: Knee range of motion (ROM), active and passive. The unit is [degrees]

primary_outcome.time_frame: Change in pain weeks before the operation to one year after the operation
primary_outcome.description: Visual analogue scale from 0 to 10 on the average level of pain in the last 24 hours with 0 meaning no pain and 10 meaning most severe pain. The unit is [n](0 best-10 worst)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before the operation, five days after the operation and one year after the operation
secondary_outcome.description: WOMAC Score (Western Ontario and McMaster University Osteoarthritis Index)

arm_group.description: Standard pre- and postoperative physical therapy without manual lymphatic drainage.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Manual lymphatic drainage before and after knee replacement
arm_group.description: Manual lymphatic drainage before and after knee replacement

arm_group.arm_group_label: Manual lymphatic drainage after knee replacement
arm_group.description: Manual lymphatic drainage after knee replacement

intervention.description: Manual Lymphatic Drainage is a form of physical therapy with the primary goal of accelerating lymphatic drainage. In this study, the manual lymphatic drainage is applied by experienced physical therapists 5 days in a row for 30 minutes each; after and/or before the surgery.
intervention.arm_group_label: Manual lymphatic drainage after knee replacement
Manual lymphatic drainage before and after knee replacement

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Total Knee Arthroplasty (TKA)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Venous insufficiency
- BMI > 38
- Vascular disease

contact_backup.last_name: Alexander Brunner, Priv.-Doz. Dr. med. univ.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Principal Investigator, Dr. med. univ. Moritz Wagner
